A paragraph should never confuse a text link with an image link

I have recently been reading The Checklist Manifesto by Atul Gawande. The idea seems so very simple, so simple that one can be forgiven for assuming that the book consists of a blog post fleshed out to fill a dead tree hardcover because that's what pays the bills. And yes, a shorter version of the material appeared the The New Yorker.
